arm_group.description: Transmastoid galvanic vestibular stimulation is applied, with the cathode placed on the left mastoid
Transmastoid galvanic vestibular stimulation is applied, with the cathode placed on the right mastoid
Transmastoid galvanic stimulation set-up is applied, with only 30s of stimulation

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether galvanic vestibular stimulation is
      effective in the treatment of spatial neglect after right brain-damage.

clinical_study.brief_title: Therapeutic Effects of Galvanic Vestibular Stimulation (GVS) on Spatial Neglect

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  spatial neglect after unilateral ischemic infarction or unilateral haemorrhage

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Chronic epilepsy

          -  Metallic implants (including pacemakers)

          -  Brain tumors

          -  Scalp inflammation

          -  Degenerative disease

clinical_study.official_title: Therapeutic Effects of Galvanic Vestibular Stimulation (GVS) on Spatial Neglect

other_outcome.description: The visual vertical is assessed with the bucket test, in which subjects are asked to indicate when a visual line is vertical for them. Deviations (in degrees) are measured.
other_outcome.measure: Change in subjective visual vertical due to intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Post  (day after last intervention session), Follow-up 1 (2 weeks after post testing), Follow-up 2 (4 after post testing)

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Ethics committee of the Ludwig-Maximilians University

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Neglect Test (NET)due to intervention, the German version of the Behavioral Inattention Test (BIT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Post (day after last intervention session), Follow-up 1 (2 weeks after post testing), Follow-up 2 (4 after post testing)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Subjects searches objects glued to a board, the time needed to do so is measured
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in visual-tactile search task due to intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Post (day after last intervention session), Follow-up 1 (2 weeks after post testing), Follow-up 2 (4 after post testing)

secondary_outcome.description: The haptic vertical is assessed with a wooden device, where subjects are asked to adjust a rod into a vertical position. Deviations (in degrees) are measured.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in subjective haptic vertical due to intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Post  (day after last intervention session), Follow-up 1 (2 weeks after post testing), Follow-up 2 (4 after post testing)

collaborator.agency: German Center for Vertigo and Balance Disorders (IFB)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
